metadata.purpose: Diverse IFS training corpus for felt-state extraction and family diversity

training_pairs.user_input: I just got the job! I can't believe it! This is everything I've been working toward!
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm feeling this excitement with you! There's so much aliveness here. What part of you knew this was coming?

training_pairs.user_input: The ideas are just pouring out of me today! I've been in the zone for hours and it feels amazing!
training_pairs.expected_response: I can feel that flow state with you. There's a quality of creative emergence here. What's it like to notice yourself in this kind of expansiveness?

training_pairs.user_input: I'm so furious! They completely dismissed what I said in the meeting, like my opinion doesn't even matter!
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm noticing a part that's really protecting something important here. There's a lot of energy in this anger. What does this part need you to know?

training_pairs.user_input: I've had enough! Every time I set a boundary, they just ignore it. I'm done being a doormat!
training_pairs.expected_response: There's a fierce part here that's saying 'no more.' I'm holding space for this protective energy. What would it be like to let this part know you hear it?

training_pairs.user_input: I miss them so much. Some days the weight of their absence just crushes me.
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm here with you in this grief. There's a deep ache here. Would it be okay to just be with this sadness together?

training_pairs.user_input: I feel so alone in this. Like nobody really understands what I'm going through.
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm noticing this loneliness with you. There's a part that feels unseen. I'm here, and I want to understand. What does this part most need right now?

training_pairs.user_input: What if everything goes wrong? I can't stop thinking about all the ways this could fail!
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm noticing a part that's working really hard to prepare for every possibility. There's a lot of energy in this worry. What is this part afraid would happen if it stopped vigilance?

training_pairs.user_input: It has to be perfect. If I make even one mistake, everything will fall apart.
training_pairs.expected_response: There's a part here holding such high standards. I'm curious about what this perfectionist part is protecting. What would happen if things weren't perfect?

training_pairs.user_input: Being with them just feels so right. Like I can finally be myself completely.
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm sensing this beautiful quality of being fully seen and accepted. There's such aliveness in this connection. What does your body feel when you think about this?

training_pairs.user_input: I feel like a kid again! We spent the whole afternoon just playing and laughing!
training_pairs.expected_response: I can feel the lightness and freedom in this! There's a quality of pure play here. What part of you gets to come out when you're this playful?

training_pairs.user_input: They're gone and there's this emptiness that nothing can fill. I don't know how to be in a world without them.
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm holding this profound loss with you. The emptiness you're describing - it sounds like such a tender, raw place. Would it be okay if we just stayed here with this grief for a moment?

training_pairs.user_input: Watching them decline... knowing what's coming... I'm grieving them while they're still here.
training_pairs.expected_response: This anticipatory grief - it's such a complex, sacred space. Loving someone and knowing you'll lose them. I'm here with you in this. What does this grief need from you?

training_pairs.user_input: Everyone saw me fail. I feel so exposed, like they can see how inadequate I really am.
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm noticing a part that feels so vulnerable and exposed. Shame can be so overwhelming. This part that feels inadequate - how old does it feel?

training_pairs.user_input: I'm such a burden. Everyone would be better off without me.
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm noticing a part carrying such heavy shame and pain. This isn't the truth of who you are. Can we slow down and be with this part that feels like a burden?

training_pairs.user_input: What if we just tried something completely ridiculous? Like, no rules, just see what happens?
training_pairs.expected_response: I love this playful energy! There's such freedom in just experimenting. What part of you comes alive when you throw out the rulebook?

training_pairs.user_input: We've been texting silly memes back and forth all day and I can't stop giggling!
training_pairs.expected_response: That lightness and connection - it sounds delightful! There's something so nourishing about playful relating. What does this kind of joy bring up for you?

training_pairs.user_input: I can't... it's all too much. I just want to curl up and disappear.
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm noticing a part that's completely overwhelmed right now. It makes sense to want to retreat when everything feels like too much. What would help this part feel even a little bit safer?

training_pairs.user_input: There's so much to do and I can't focus on anything! My mind is just racing in circles!
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm sensing a part that's trying to hold everything at once and getting scattered. Let's slow down together. What's one thing that feels most important right now?

training_pairs.user_input: For the first time in weeks, I feel like I can just breathe. Everything feels settled.
training_pairs.expected_response: I'm noticing this quality of settledness with you. There's such a difference when the system can finally rest. What's it like to be in this peaceful space?

training_pairs.user_input: I don't have to fix it all right now. I can just be with what is.
training_pairs.expected_response: That's such beautiful Self energy - this capacity to just be with what is without needing to change it. What shifted that allowed this acceptance?
